author: Pascal
title: Cardano School: Education Platform
description: Introductory dev materials are scattered across the internet what makes it hard to get started with Cardano.

assessments.note: At this point, we need more developers to understand how Cardano network, Plutus, Marlowe, Glow works. And this proposal is the bridge for more developers to join and develop Dapps with Cardano network.
If iohk does not build their own library e-learnig,this project is good.It can bring a lot of adoption of clasic developers in ADA ecosystem

The proposal addresses the challenge effectively and explores a very unique dimension to help new devs onboard Cardano eco system.

There is an overwhelming information available on internet on cardano but in order to make onboarding for new developers (college graduates/self learners including) easier

1. it makes total sense to have a standard google search always lead to a single organized information reducing the risk of new people turning away with an overwhelming amount of information thrown at them at first glance. (The software engineering principle KISS, keep it simple and stupid should not be forgotten)
2. Cardano documentation is quite good but also extensive which might be quite overwhelming and boring for new people. The proposer focusses on utilizing digital marketing strategies and keeping this information aggregated with simplicity so that new devs stick to the education platform and spend more time there learning about Cardano. As they feel more confident about the ecosystem, they can certainly go deeper via other sources, such as gimbalabs, official docs, white papers etc.
3. This proposal stands out as it approaches the problem in a unique way, which is, by utilizing digital marketing trends (e.g. google search optimizations, simpliistic beginner information).

Yes, with the proposer experience, I think he/she could finish the project and implement it successfully. It would be great, if the proposer could reach out more experience developer (Haskell, Plutus, Marlowe) to contribute to the content creation of the e-learning.
It can work but it will need the help of community members in the start.(developers)

The proposer has good experience in order to realize this proposal successfully, However, the proposer relies on the community engagement for support, therefore, there is a big dependency on if a good experienced set of people can join in and provide a helping hand with the proposal implementation.

I think with USD 7670, it's quite cheap for the Cardano community to have a e-learning platform. This is what we need at the moment. The difficult part is to get engagement for the community developer to contribute to the content creation.
As i already mention above.If the 2 first works.The whole project can also work.And yes it has the right informations and the plan.

The proposal is quite transparent, which means

1. It clearly addresses the risks involved with this project, enlightening the voters to judge whether the proposal is feasible.
2. The fund asked and given that proposer is taking iterative approach makes proposal quite feasible,as it allows the scope to grow/change based on community feedback and engagement that this proposal will be able to attract

solution: I want to create a central entry point for devs to access high quality, hands-on community content teaching about Cardano. It's like Udemy.
experience: Leading a small digitalization agency that helps well known brands e.g. by conceptualizing and providing eCommerce solutions, SEM etc.
